column10: How objective the method is. Impacts can be counting or visual methods.
The resources needed for this method (e.g. aquarium, live samples).
A lot of specific resources (e.g. aquarium) required.
If the method is possible and easy in the field.
How much time is needed for the method to work.
Possible in the field and easy to do.
Not a lot of specific conditions required.

column9: The scores go from 0-5. The highest possible total score is 20.

column10: Method can only be achieved after months

column9: The higher the score the better the method in all categories.

column10: Method can be achieved in days.

column9: We will only look at methods that are not specific for one singular paper.
Methods that are similar (e.g. in situ, in situ2, etc.) will be categorized under one singular name.
